column2: Legg Mason gets a foothold in campaign to re-engineer ETFs NEW YORK
column3: Jan 22 Legg Mason Inc said on Friday it bought a stake in a company re-engineering exchange-traded funds in the hope of improving the performance of the popular investment products.

column2: US Navy's Fort Worth LCS ship suffers gear damage in Singapore WASHINGTON
column3: Jan 21 The USS Fort Worth
column4: a new coastal warship built by Lockheed Martin Corp for the U.S. Navy
column5: suffered damage to its combining gears while the ship was in port in Singapore

Mondelez settles with California over lead in Nabisco Ginger Snaps Jan 22 Mondelez International Inc has agreed to pay $750
column4: improve its product sourcing and testing

column2: FDA issues Class I recall on St. Jude's defibrillator leads Jan 22 St. Jude Medical Inc said the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has issued a Class I recall on faulty parts of its devices implanted into patients to control irregular heartbeats.
Starbucks still hot on China despite muted sales Jan 22 Tepid growth in Asia might have taken some steam out of Starbucks Corp's latest quarterly sales
column3: but both the company and analysts remain upbeat about the coffee chain's prospects in China.
